basics.name: Samuel Newton Bunga
basics.label: Bioinformatics Software Developer
basics.summary:
Hi! I'm a Bioinformatics Software Developer at Harvard Medical School. I am working on to support DARPA Panacea project which aims \
in developing new therapeutic drugs to block pain and inflammation using novel pharmacological platforms. My primary responsibilities are to develop and maintain \
existing RNA-Seq bulk/single-cell pipelines and also to develop new modules and integrate them into the pipelines using INDRA modelling systems developed at LSP.

courses: Computational Methods â€“ 1 and 2, Bioinformatics Programming, Machine Learning, Data Analytics

highlights: Co-supervise and conduct lab sessions for 30 students and held office hours every week
Provide comprehensive academic support and mentored students on individual basis
Conduct and evaluate student quizzes and assignments
Written Perl/BASH scripts to grade assignments automatically and produce a score card

Designed and developed a free open web application (Single Cell Wizard) for processing of Single Cell pair-end raw FASTQ files processed either by following 10X, CelSeq or DropSeq protocols and for single-end SRA files to generate feature-barcode matrices. The generated Matrix file can be taken up for clustering and GEA
Worked to develop 4 in house dependency tools for Single Cell Wizard pipeline like FASTQ demultiplexer and FASTQ cleaner to remove singleton nucleotides and low-quality reads from each sample
Assembled and created a Database for Gene expression markers that define cell types which can be used to annotate clusters of single cells via Gene Set Enrichment Analysis
Built a workflow to merge up to 30 in house and public Single Cell Datasets of Human and Mice using Seurat

Conducted testing, maintenance and monitoring system process using in house and third-party tools and maintained ongoing relations with vendors, conduct product evaluations, participate in vendor selection, negotiating prices

volunteer.summary: Single Cell RNA-seq pre/post processing pipeline
highlights: SCWiz is a comprehensive Single Cell RNA-Seq processing pipeline which is a totally automated platform that can take raw FASTQ files, process them to generate feature barcode matrices and perform pre-processing, data normalization, quality control to differentially expressed genes, annotation of clusters and final visualization
Compiled over 100 plant metabolites in Ayurvedic formulations and forming up an interactome which could serve as a lead for potential drug targets that can be taken up for clinical trials
